attributes.action: Make it law that all customers must wear masks for close contact services
attributes.additional_details: Continually we have clients claim they are exempt from wearing masks in our salon and we are legally obliged to carry out a service on a customer not wearing a mask in close contact. What about our human rights and the anxiety this causes our staff and other clients within the premises.
attributes.background: To make it a legal requirement for customers to wear a mask for any close contact services or the business has the right to refuse service to protect the employees that feel vulnerable in these circumstances

rejection.details:
In England the indoor sittings in which people must wear a face covering (unless they are exempt) includes premises providing personal care and beauty treatments (hair salons, barbers, nail salons, massage centres, tattoo and piercing parlours): https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/face-coverings-when-to-wear-one-and-how-to-make-your-own/face-coverings-when-to-wear-one-and-how-to-make-your-own

Businesses are already able to refuse service to customers, although if they did so on the basis of a protected characteristic, such as disability, this may constitute unlawful discrimination.

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Require people exempt from wearing face coverings to wear a face shield: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555541
